title: Community Development Grant - Small

description: This grant program provides up to $250,000 to support eligible commercial, mixed-use, and light manufacturing projects, covering up to 75% of costs specifically for new construction.
detailed_overview: Small grants up to $250,000 are intended to support eligible commercial, mixed-use and light manufacturing projects. Grants provide funding for up to 75% of total eligible project costs involving new construction, [description continues, but text is cut off].

title: Capacity Building Grant (2025 Cycle)
funder: Advocates for Urban Agriculture (AUA) in partnership with Food:Land:Opportunity (F.L.O.)
amount: Not specified in the provided text
description: A grant fund supporting urban farms and community gardens in the Chicago area to enrich the local food economy, production, and distribution.
detailed_overview: The Capacity Building Grant is housed by Advocates for Urban Agriculture (AUA) in partnership with Food:Land:Opportunity (F.L.O.) and operates as a model for community-led resource distribution. The funds support urban farms and community gardens throughout the Chicago area. Recipients are selected by an Advisory Committee composed of community residents, past grantees, growers, or supporters of earth stewardship. The 2025 cycle utilizes a nomination process (community members can nominate, or spaces can self-nominate) to reduce the administrative burden. Nominations were due by 3pm CST on October 3rd, 2025, and funds were scheduled to be awarded by December 10th, 2025.
eligibility: Urban farms and community gardens operating throughout the Chicago area.
application_requirements: Completion of the Capacity Building Grant nomination form (via Google Form or email)
Submission by the published deadline (3pm CST)
Optional: Submission of draft documents for grant writing support
